page.title: 04Carrington House in Deptford
page.content: Carrington House is a men's hostel with 550 beds.It costs twelve pounds a week for a cubicle with bed and chair, and fifteen pounds sixty pence a week for a lockable cubicle. There is a can- teen, a common room where men can cook their own food, two TV rooms & a games room. It is very clean and no alcohol is allowed in the building.The methers, dossers & tramps seen around Deptford do not usually live in the hostel. Many of the men,however,have problems. There are post-psychiatric patients who are unable to look after themselves.Many of them have marital, drink, gambling or drug problems. There is one welfare officer but the men are just as likely to go to cleaners & porters with their problems as to him. The staff do not try to reform the inmates but are will- ing to give help and advice. The hostel is also used by the single homeless.
